message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
public Iterator<E> iterator(int x) {
    ListIterator iterator = new ListIterator();
    for(int i = 0; i < x; i++) {
        iterator.next();
    }
    return iterator;
}
<<<explanation>>>: In the iterator(int x) method, you can create a new ListIterator and then use a for loop to call the next() method x number of times to move the iterator to the desired position in the list. Then, you can return the iterator. This way, the ListIterator constructor that starts at the head is not affected.
